title: Drawing, "Project for a Wooden Pavilion", 1815–40
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and pink, red, organge and green watercolor, black chalk on paper
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Design for a gazebo.  The octagonal pavilion stands on a square platform, to which steps lead on every side.  The pavilion has a dado.  Columns support the entablature; their capitals are connected by festoons.  Statues stand in the intercolumnar spaces.  The walls of the pavilion and the slanting roof show Gothic details.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Project for a Wooden Pavilion", 1815–40.
1815–40. Pen and black ink, brush and pink, red, organge and green watercolor, black chalk on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-3878.
